SEARCH
Module com.example.appproject
Package com.example.appproject

Class Interpreter

java.lang.Object
com.example.appproject.Interpreter
public class Interpreter extends Object
The Interpreter Class manages the instructions entered by the user. It checks if the instruction the syntax is fitting the language and executes the corresponding behavior.

      static boolean stop
      This attribute is used to determine if the execution has to be interrupted or not. It is used in the interpret and interpretWithoutDelay methods.

  • Method Details

    • interpret

      public static void interpret(String input, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor cursors, Cursor cursor, MapVariable variables, int numLine)
      The method launches the execution of the instructions entered by the user, if a delay is requested between each execution. It pauses the running of the programme between each instruction, for as long as Interface.executeTime.
      Parameters:
      input -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursors -
      cursor -
      variables -
      numLine - the line number of the current execute instruction

      numLine -

    • executeInstruction

      private static void executeInstruction(String instruction, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor cursors, Cursor cursor, MapVariable variables, int numLine) throws Exception
      The executeInstruction method is used to execute the instructions asked by the user. The instruction takes the form of a String composed of tokens (Strings separated by " "). The first token is the actual instruction (FWD, BWD, HIDE, ...), it is caught with a switch to execute the right behavior for each possible instruction, or throw an exception if no known instruction is detected. For each instruction, the selected Cursor object has its attributes updated and the Interface object, which is the drawing area seen by the user, is updated. Every executed instruction or Errors/Exceptions are stored in the History and printed in the history console on the interface.
      Parameters:
      instruction -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursors -
      cursor -
      variables -
      numLine -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • executeFwd

      private static void executeFwd(String[] tokens, Interface interfaceInstance, Cursor cursor, MapVariable variables) throws Exception, UndefinedVariableException
      Executes the FWD (forward) instruction. It moves the cursor following its direction by the "distance" entered by the user. It takes into account if the user entered a percentage, symbolized with a '%' or not.
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursor -
      Throws:
      Exception
      UndefinedVariableException

    • executeBwd

      private static void executeBwd(String[] tokens, Interface interfaceInstance, Cursor cursor) throws Exception
      Executes the BWD (backward) instruction. It moves the cursor following its direction by the "distance" entered by the user. It takes into account if the user entered a percentage, symbolized with a '%' or not.
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursor -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • executePos

      private static void executePos(String[] tokens, Interface interfaceInstance, Cursor cursor) throws Exception
      Executes the POS (position) instruction. It changes the coordinates of the selected cursor to values entered as arguments.
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursor -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • executeMove

      private static void executeMove(String[] tokens, Interface interfaceInstance, Cursor cursor) throws Exception
      Executes the MOV (move) instruction. As executePos() but it draws the line between the last position of the cursor and the new one.
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursor -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • executeLookAt

      private static void executeLookAt(String[] tokens, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor mapCursor, Cursor cursor) throws Exception
      Executes the LOOKAT instructions which can be called with different parameters. The coordinates as integers, a cursor ID as an integer or the abscissa and ordinate in percentages of the canvas.
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      interfaceInstance -
      mapCursor - The Map of cursors is needed when the selected cursor is asked to look at another cursor.
      cursor -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • applyColor

      private static void applyColor(String[] tokens, Interface interfaceInstance, Cursor cursor) throws Exception
      Executes the instruction COLOR by applying the wanted color to the selected cursor.

      The color can be specified through web format (#RRGGBB) in hexa, in rgb with integers from to 0 to 255 or float numbers from 0 to 1. The user does not have to specify the format when it calls the COLOR instruction. If the user types "COLOR 1 1 1", the program considers it to be integers. So it will apply the color (1,1,1) in RGB format and not (255,255,255). (255,255,255) can be applied with (1.0,1.0,1.0) for example, or as long as at least a double number is called (example (1.0,1,1) also works).

      Parameters:
      tokens -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursor -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • executeCursor

      private static void executeCursor(String[] tokens, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor cursors) throws NewCursorException
      Executes the CURSOR instruction by creating a Cursor Object and displaying it on the drawing area. The new Cursor is placed at the center of the drawing area. The syntax is CURSOR id_value.
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursors -
      Throws:
      Exception
      NewCursorException

    • handleForLoop

      private static void handleForLoop(String[] tokens, String instruction, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor cursors, Cursor cursor, MapVariable variables, int numLine) throws Exception
      Executes the FOR instruction by executing the instructions contained in the instruction block with a loop defined by the parameters. It needs a variable, a starting and finishing value. The syntax is FOR var_name FROM start TO end STEP stepValue. FROM, STEP and stepValue are optional. The default value of start is 0, and the default of stepValue is 1.
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      instruction -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursors -
      cursor -
      variables -
      numLine -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • executeIf

      private static void executeIf(String[] tokens, String instruction, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor cursors, Cursor cursor, MapVariable variables, int numLine) throws Exception
      Executes the IF instructions by executing the block of instructions if the boolean expression's value is true. The syntax is IF var_name.
      Parameters:
      tokens - Contains de block of instructions to execute and the boolean expression as tokens[1].
      instruction -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursors -
      cursor -
      variables -
      numLine -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • evaluateBooleanExpression

      private static boolean evaluateBooleanExpression(String condition) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method evaluates the boolean expression entered as a String parameter and returns its boolean value. It first parses the condition to obtain its corresponding boolean value. The method does not implement the parenthesis for a boolean expression.
      Parameters:
      condition -
      Returns:
      the value of the condition
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - handles inputs which values are not boolean

    • executeWhile

      private static void executeWhile(String[] tokens, String instruction, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor cursors, Cursor cursor, MapVariable variables, int numLine) throws Exception
      Executes the WHILE instruction by first assessing the condition following the WHILE key-word, and then by executing the block of instructions. It needs an existing boolean variable. The syntax is WHILE var_name .
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      instruction -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursors -
      cursor -
      variables -
      numLine -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • splitCommand

      private static List<String> splitCommand(String instruction)
      Parses the instructions entered as inputs. This method is the first step to executing any instruction. It is called when the RUN button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      instruction -
      Returns:
      a list containing each item appearing in the instruction except spaces.

    • executeMimic

      private static void executeMimic(String[] tokens, String instruction, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor cursors, Cursor cursor, MapVariable variables, int numLine) throws MimicException
      Executes the MIMIC command by executing the block of instructions on the selected cursor and the temporary cursor created at the position of the cursor entered as parameter.
      Parameters:
      tokens - Contains the id of the cursor that will execute the block of instructions, the temporary cursor will mimic its behavior.
      instruction -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursors -
      cursor - The selected cursor, the temporary cursor will be created as a model of this cursor.
      variables -
      numLine -
      Throws:
      MimicException

    • executeMirror

      private static void executeMirror(String[] tokens, String instruction, Interface interfaceInstance, MapCursor cursors, Cursor cursor, MapVariable variables, int numLine) throws Exception
      Executes the MIRROR command. After a cursor is selected, another one is temporarly used to execute a block of instructions. The temporary cursor is created by two ways. Version 1 : the temporary cursor is symmetrical to the chosen cursor by using a central symmetry with the coordinates of a chosen point. Version 2 the temporary cursor is symmetrical to the chosen cursor by using a symmetrical axis with the coordinates of two chosen points.
      Parameters:
      tokens -
      instruction -
      interfaceInstance -
      cursors -
      cursor -
      variables -
      numLine -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • executeNum

      private static void executeNum(String[] tokens, Interface interfaceInstance, MapVariable vars)
      Executes the NUM command and creates a new Num (extension of Variable) Object.
      Parameters:
      tokens - Contains the name of the new variable and eventually its value (a Double).
      interfaceInstance -
      vars -

      Executes the DEL instruction and remove from vars (Map of the existing variables) the designated variable.
      Parameters:
      tokens - Contains the name (Key in the MapVariable) of the variable to remove as tokens[1].
      interfaceInstance -
      vars -
